Ernst, thank you so much for EVERYTHING. Your home is amazing and comfortable, and your company and humour are even better. Wishing you all the best, and I hope I can host you sometime in Malaysia or Canada. You're awesome!

Great experience!

Ernst, I wish you all the best. Thanks for this great two days. Hope to see you soon. whenever you will visit Germany or Austria just let me know!

Ernst is the most laidback, friendly and easygoing person every. He showed me and my friend Linda around Copenhagen, and we had may laughs together. His flat was spotless, and easy accessible from the trainstation.  Do open your home for him,  if he is passing your area and need a couch!
Min case es su casa, Ernst:D

text:
Vytenė and Jurgita were hitchhiking from Horsens  in Denmark to Nijmegen and decided spontaneously to stay in Groningen for a night. 
Vytenė is easy going, chill and cheerful. She likes to play boardgames and cardgames, she is a good guest, polite and friendly, I recommend hosting her.
Vytene stayed less 12h before she and her friend has to hit the road again but she was a cool guest, and gave me a candy for breakfast, miam :)

Having Vita and Jurgrita for two nights has brought joy, fun, and happiness to my place, they were both easy going and flexible. Vita is such a smart and kind girl who has taught me a new boarding game which I’m grateful for.

I hope life will give us the chance to meet again, take care!

Vytene was super fun to spend time with. She was energetic and entusiastic. She wanted to visit everything I suggested and we had fun doing so. She has a good humor and seems like a strong minded woman. Also, she brought some board games with her! We had fun playing Monopoly deal while waiting for food in the restaurant and in the evening with some tea. I found Vytene to be a warm, responsible and good humored guest. I would take her in as my guest again anytime. Cheers!

Vytene stayed at my place in Hamburg for one night and two days and was very eager to do all the things that I had in mind for the weekend! She is fun and up for everything and we went canueing in the canels of Hamburg, as well as visited a lot of other sights in Hamburg

Vyte and Vika were just fantastic guests. I totally enjoyed their presence, they are fun to be with and to talk to. The only problem I have with them is that they didn't stay for too long :) They came rather late, but that's understandable since it was Vyte's birthday and they decided to celebrate it by hitchhiking to Skagen and then to my place. We were playing boardgames the whole night, and I managed to fall in love with Monopoly Deal (what a game, seriously) and this Lithuanian game where you are supposed to place certain historical events on a timeline (and learned about the existence of the mighty Sniego Žmogus thanks to it). Cool, friendly, outgoing people that nobody should miss at their place!

She is a very cheerful and crazy (in good way) girl! She showed me around the city and we saw a lot more f weird things and beautiful places. I was so lucky to meet such a wonderful host since this is my first time to use Couchsurfing!!! We talked a lot and had very good time:D

Vytene has hosted me for a while in her nice apartment situated in the centre of the city.  She was a really nice person with an interesting life view. Vytene cooked some amazing food for me, I don't know the name but it tasted awesome. She showed me around a few secret places in Horsens. She also has a huge collection of board games, some of them are really addictive. Careful playing Monopoly Deal with her, she's a badass in it!

This was my first time couchsurfing and thanks to Vita it went amazing.  She is an easy-going, open-minded and friendly Lithuanian whom you want to hang out with. She showed me and my friend around the city, told a lot about the students life in Horsens and shared few precious tips about traveling.  We cooked together and played  a nice board game  (never ever try to beat  Vytenė :) Her flat was really cozy with awesome pics of her adventures all over the walls ^^
Dėkoju Vytenė  and keep in touch :)

Vyte answered my last minute request very quickly, and she was also very nice to me and my friend. Thanks to her we saw the beach (the most beautiful place in Horsens), her university (from the top of the roof), played board games and tried a new shopping experience. Vyte is a very interesting and polite person, her flat is very neat and cozy. I finally had an opportunity to cook!!! Thank you for everything, we had a good time

Vytenė is a sweet girl, maybe at the first glance shy but she has adventurous Lithuanian soul which is great for Couchsurfing hosting and meeting people. 
Thanks to her she accepted me to stay at her couch and we had great time together. 
House was cozy and clean, we cooked some food together and had a nice conversations.  
Oh, yea, and the location is perfect, it's in the city center so everything is extremely close. 
I can recommend Vytenė as a host! :)
Kasper is a really friendly guy. Was a pleasure to host him.
Kasper is an easygoing cool no-nonsense easy to host guy.  We had great conversations, a beer and a lot of smiles and laughter during his short stay. Welcome back anytime Kasper.
Kasper and his friend, Laura are great people - we had fun going out together, they are nice and polite surfers.
